passage_text: Yvon /yvon/ [2 sylls.] as a name for boys is of French origin, and Yvon means yew. Yvon is a version of Yves (French): transcription of the German name Ivo. Yvon is pronounced similarly to Avon, Evan ▲ , Even, Evin, Evion, Evyn, Ivan, Iven and Ivon. Another recommended similar baby name is Yvor. These names tend to be more frequently used than Yvon.

French Meaning: The name Yvon is a French baby name. In French the meaning of the name Yvon is: Archer. SoulUrge Number: 6. Expression Number: 22. People with this name have a deep inner desire for a stable, loving family or community, and a need to work with others and to be appreciated. People with this name tend to be a powerful force to all whose lives they touch.

Origin of the name Yvonne: French feminine form of Yvon and Yves, names of Germanic origin derived from the element iv (yew). From A World of Baby Names by Teresa Norman. My middle name is Yvonne as well (first name Caroline) seems there are a lot of us with the middle name of Yvonne, it's a lovely name. My Grandmother on my Mother's side was named Yvonne, I hope to one day use it as a middle name for a daughter of my own.
Yvon is a form of the name Yvonne. The meaning of Yvonne is yew. It may also mean archer as bows were made from yew wood. The names Erwan, Ivo are all forms of Yvon.

Origin: French. Meaning: The French name Yvon means-An alternate form of Ivan, a Russian form of John, from the Hebrew for God's gracious gift, and Yves, from the Scandinavian for an archer.. Rating: Add This Name to my Favorite List. Rate this Name! View All Names by Origin.

Yvon is a rare given name for males but a somewhat popular last name for both adults and children (#88825 out of 150436, Top 59%). (2000 U.S. Census). The only popular varying form of Yvon (not in Top 1000) is Ivar. Forms like Yvo are uncommon. Yvon is pronounced similarly to Avon, Evan ▲ , Even, Evin, Evion, Evyn, Ivan, Iven and Ivon. Another recommended similar baby name is Yvor. These names tend to be more frequently used than Yvon.

Meaning of Yvon. French name. In French, the name Yvon means-male form of yvonne.The name Yvon originated as an French name. The name Yvon is most often used as a boy name or male name. French Name Meaning-male form of yvonne.

Yvonne /ɪˈvɒn/ is a female given name. It is French in origin, and is the female form of Yvon, which is derived from the Germanic name Yves. It is from the Germanic word iv, meaning yew. Since yew wood was used for bows, Ivo may have been an occupational name meaning archer. This name first arrived in England with the Norman invasion, along with variations such as Yvette, and male versions of the same name. It was the most popular of all of these names, but eventually died out from usage.

Yvonne /yvon-ne/ [2 sylls.] as a girls' name is pronounced ee-VAHN. It is of French and Old German origin, and the meaning of Yvonne is  yew . Feminine variant of Yves, a saint's name, and Ivo. Since yew wood was used for bows, Ivo may have been an occupational name meaning archer. Tennis celebrity Evonne Goolagong; actress Yvonne DeCarlo.

It has also lost popularity in France, where in 1900, it was the 7th most popular name. Yvonne has several name days: 29 May in Sweden and 8 August in Norway. Common variations of this name include Evonne, Evone, Yvonette, Ivonette, Ywona, Iwona, Yvonnie, Yvon. Since yew wood was used for bows, Ivo may have been an occupational name meaning archer. This name first arrived in England with the Norman invasion, along with variations such as Yvette, and male versions of the same name. It was the most popular of all of these names, but eventually died out from usage.
